title: 105_s519
content: The Act may be cited as the "OPIC Termination Act" and it involves the termination of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. The Overseas Private Investment Corporation will cease issuing new obligations and activities under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961, and will be abolished 180 days after the Act's enactment. Existing contracts and agreements will not be affected by these changes. The Overseas Private Investment Corporation will be abolished 180 days after the enactment of the Act. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will take over the Corporation's functions related to contracts and agreements until their expiration, without renewing them. Title IV of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 will be repealed, but will still apply to the Director's functions. Upon the repeal of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, funds will be transferred to the Director to continue performing the Corporation's functions until contracts expire. Any remaining funds will be deposited in the Treasury. SEC. 3. SAVINGS PROVISIONS. Prior determinations, regulations, and contracts issued under the provisions of law before the repeal shall remain in effect until modified or terminated by authorized officials or by law. The repeal will not affect pending proceedings before the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. No insurance, reinsurance, guarantee, or loan may be issued under any pending application. Proceedings related to functions performed by the Director after the repeal will continue. Orders issued in such proceedings will remain in effect until modified or revoked by the Director, a court, or by law. The discontinuance or modification of proceedings can occur under the same terms as if this Act had not been enacted. The Director is authorized to issue regulations for the transfer of proceedings continued under this Act. Suits commenced before the repeal will not be affected, and proceedings will continue as if the Act had not been enacted. Liabilities incurred by officers of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation will not abate due to the Act. The Overseas Private Investment Corporation and its officers' actions and liabilities will not be affected by the enactment of this Act. Any ongoing suits involving the Corporation or its officers will continue with the Director substituted or added as a party. Orders and actions of the Director will be subject to judicial review as if issued by the Corporation. The Overseas Private Investment Corporation's functions are subject to statutory requirements for notice, hearings, and administrative review when exercised by the Director. SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Title 5, United States Code is amended by removing specific positions at the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Additionally, amendments are made to the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to reflect changes related to the OPIC Abolition Act. Amendments are made to various sections of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 and the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 to remove references to the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Amendments are made to various sections of different acts to remove references to the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Amendments are made to remove references to the Overseas Private Investment Corporation in various sections of different acts. The changes specify countries eligible for assistance based on obligated amounts from the previous fiscal year and modify reporting requirements under the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act. Amendments are made to various acts to remove references to the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Changes specify eligible countries based on previous fiscal year obligations and modify reporting requirements under the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act. Amendments repeal certain provisions of law related to the Overseas Private Investment Corporation and modify reporting requirements under the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act. The Investment Corporation Amendments Act of 1988, referenced in Public Law 100-461, will take effect 180 days after enactment.
